intro: Odontites hispidulus, commonly known as the hairy toothed grass, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe and western Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads and fibrous root system. The plant features narrow, hairy leaves and produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in the summer months. Odontites hispidulus is often found in moist, calcareous soils and is adapted to harsh alpine environments. Its unique morphology and ecological niche make it an important species in high-altitude flora.
